00001 #ifndef _ESM_PGRD_H
00002 #define _ESM_PGRD_H
00003 
00004 #include "esm_reader.hpp"
00005 
00006 namespace ESM {
00007 
00008 /*
00009  * Path grid.
00010  */
00011 struct PathGrid
00012 {
00013   struct DATAstruct
00014   {
00015     int x, y; // Grid location, matches cell for exterior cells
00016     short s1; // ?? Usually but not always a power of 2. Doesn't seem
00017           // to have any relation to the size of PGRC.
00018     short s2; // Number of path points? Size of PGRP block is always 16 * s2;
00019   }; // 12 bytes
00020 
00021   std::string cell; // Cell name
00022   DATAstruct data;
00023   ESM_Context context; // Context so we can return here later and
00024                        // finish the job
00025 
00026   void load(ESMReader &esm)
00027   {
00028     esm.getHNT(data, "DATA", 12);
00029     cell = esm.getHNString("NAME");
00030 
00031     // Remember this file position
00032     context = esm.getContext();
00033     
00034     // Check that the sizes match up. Size = 16 * s2 (path points?)
00035     if(esm.isNextSub("PGRP"))
00036       {
00037         esm.skipHSub();
00038     int size = esm.getSubSize();
00039     if(size != 16*data.s2)
00040       esm.fail("Path grid table size mismatch");
00041       }
00042 
00043     // Size varies. Path grid chances? Connections? Multiples of 4
00044     // suggest either int or two shorts, or perhaps a float. Study
00045     // it later.
00046     if(esm.isNextSub("PGRC"))
00047       {
00048     esm.skipHSub();
00049     int size = esm.getSubSize();
00050     if(size % 4 != 0)
00051       esm.fail("PGRC size not a multiple of 4");
00052       }
00053   }
00054 };
00055 }
00056 #endif
